definition: silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc
to walk a tightrope (literally or figuratively)

sentences.english: Effective measure solving the problem on decrease of rope is to use the steel wire rope with metal core.
sentences.chinese: 解決鋼絲繩直徑減小的有效措施是使用鋼芯鋼絲繩。

sentences.english: Effective measure solving the problem on decrease of rope is to use the steel wire rope with metal core.
sentences.chinese: 解決鋼絲繩直徑減小的有效措施是使用鋼芯鋼絲繩。

sentences.english: Chief officer, the wire rope loose.
This product is adopted wire of style bending.
sentences.chinese: 起絨針布特點是鋼絲採用進口鋼絲。

sentences.english: This product is adopted wire of style bending.
sentences.chinese: 起絨針布特點是鋼絲採用進口鋼絲。

sentences.english: What is the use of that wire which he has fastened there?
sentences.chinese: 他拴在那裏的那根鋼絲繩有什麼用處了？

sentences.english: The building is wrapped in a fine, almost scaly veil of stainless steel wire mesh.
sentences.chinese: 該建築被包裹在很精細的類似鱗片狀的不鏽鋼絲網內。

sentences.english: A wireline bailer that is used to remove sand and debris from the bottom of a well.
sentences.chinese: 從井底去除砂子和碎片所用的由鋼絲繩起下的撈砂筒。

sentences.english: The polished rod is attached to the horsehead by the bridle.
sentences.chinese: 光桿用一段鋼絲繩固定於驢頭。

sentences.english: The audience held their breath as the acrobat walked along the tightrope .
sentences.chinese: 雜技演員走鋼絲時，觀從們都屏住了呼吸。

sentences.english: I should have let the wire do the work.
sentences.chinese: 我應該讓鋼絲繩完成這部份工作。

sentences.english: The present invention relates to a wire-brush and its manufacturing method.
sentences.chinese: 本發明係一種鋼絲刷及製作方法。

sentences.english: He used to walk on a tightrope across the Niagara Falls.
sentences.chinese: 他常走鋼絲來跨越尼亞拉加瀑布。

sentences.english: This paper introduces the principle of non-destructive ration examining device for TCK wire rope.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了TCK型鋼絲繩無損定量檢測裝置的檢測原理。

sentences.english: Steel cord is used in the tire belt;
sentences.chinese: 鋼簾線用於輪胎帶束，胎圈鋼絲加固輪胎緣。

definition: the front (nose) of a plane etc
